data.title: Can not choose AI player spawnpoints when human player is spectator
data.body:
Bug in lobby.
When human player is observer, it is impossible to select a spawnpoints of AI players on the map.

data.title: Gates
data.body: There are already custom made sprites in mods/ra/bits for both soviets/allies as well as horizontal/vertical (agate.shp, sgate.shp, vgate.shp) with complete open/close plus destruction animations. Currently unused because of missing code. Depends on #2248.

data.title: Drag beyond the radar map problem
data.body:
Bug with a radar map: drag on radar while holding LMB, if go beyond the radar map, it begins to trace the units. It's annoying for navigating.

![screen-OpenRA-drag_beyond_radar_map](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1625116/440991/dab536d8-b10c-11e2-9ea7-29d3408c4e3a.png)

data.title: Added support for Tiberian Sun/Red Alert 2 SHP format

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body:
Thanks to @katzsmile who added this to his SHPViewer fork. Tested with #3192, but it will also work in-game: http://www.moddb.com/mods/cnc-reimage/videos/open-ra-engine-shpts-format-demo

![aE5x3Xx](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/756669/439498/c23c2b66-b0e4-11e2-9f2b-82dfb77fc67e.png)

Note: since Tiberian Sun the shadows are separated and many units also make use of overlays so this requires #2211 when we do a ts mod.

data.title: Created an Asset Browser to view and convert Sprites

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body:
This addresses #2532 and #2865.

For our pixel artists who are alienated by command line interfaces. This streamlines the graphical modding process with a nice quick preview that shows everything put into the mounted mods folders without any sequence files to be set up.

The workflow
- Watch how the existing sprite look like
- Export one to PNG to fiddle around with it
- Import an edited one by converting it to an SHP

is now completely GUIfied with some error handling.

![uL97h5D](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/756669/437959/7c9b6f34-b0b4-11e2-995a-9d603422b02a.png)

It will also help me with #2566 in the future.

data.title: fix incomplete bridge repair on allies02
Remove RA2 assets

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
The volkov voices irom*.aud have been ripped from RA2:YR (they are from the mission where you need to evacuate premier romanov).
RA2 was never freewared, so you shouldn't be distributing these.

data.title: AI loops build when not enough space
data.body:
If there is no space for the construction of buildings, any AI players are once again trying to build the same thing, but do not change their minds. You can see that on the map Apollo in the lower left corner, AI player tries to build a second Ore Refinery, cancel and re-built it endlessly.

What them actually need to do:

1) Build next necessary building which can fit in the free cells.

2) Or just cleaning space by selling some redundant buildings on the way, like turrets, silos, e.t.c. (may be moving units too)

data.title: Remember ALL / TEAM chat switch
data.body:
To send a message ingame, there are two channels : ALL and TEAM.

Once a sentense is typed and sent to the TEAM channel, the player can close the UI.

But later, if the player wants to send another message, the chat system is reset to "ALL channel".

The chat system should remember what channel was chosen last time and it should keep it.

data.title: Admin announcement message does not look right
data.body:
```
(player 0):     Current admin is $user
```

on dedicated servers should probably be formatted as a Debug message (like the one announcing the order lag) for consistency.

data.body: to check if we can still compile with MonoDevelop/Visual Studio for the numerous times where someone forget to add his new file to .csproj or some flags are not set correctly.

data.title: Removed duplicate e8.shp and documented the Dune II SHP converter
data.body: The non-controversial commits from #3119.

data.title: Very slow after bombing ennemy (Easy AI)
data.body:
Hi,

I was playing (my first game) against Easy AI, then bombed its [building used to create building] with a nuclear missile, and the game freezed a few seconds and then became very laggy.
I suppose that was because of the AI performing too long computations.

Version: The .deb hosted on the website.

Regards,
Valentin

data.body: closes #3157

data.title: Fixed NullReferenceException for unknown IPs in Lobby Tooltip
data.body:
This fixes #3167.

The lobby client tooltip can now handle not yet known IPs, too. It was not the Ping because that is initialized with -1.

data.title: Dune 2000 mod is not installed completely on Windows

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
@psydev added a new folders to mods/d2k without updating the NSIS Installer script so this gets you an incomplete Windows installation which will crash the game because of missing weapon/*.yamls.

Reported by THEAQIB in IRC and http://forum.dune2k.com/topic/24184-opend2k-cross-platform-reimplementation-of-dune-2000/page-10#entry380546
